decision_conditions: The proposed development, by virtue of its height, siting, bulk, location forward of the front building line of Nos. 209 Southbury Road, width and proximity to the site boundary would give rise to an unacceptable loss of sunlight / daylight, outlook and result in an overbearing impact and sense of enclosure as perceived from neighbouring properties including Nos. 209 Southbury Road , contrary to Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), CP4 and CP30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010) and DMD6, DMD8, DMD11 and DMD37 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).

The proposed two storey side extension, by virtue of its height, width, siting, bulk, roof form and proximity to the site boundary would appear visually intrusive, incongruous, overly dominant, result in the creation of a continuous facade of properties or 'terracing effect' and an incongruous roof form that is out of keeping with the character and appearance of the host building and the surrounding area of which it forms part, contrary to Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policies D3 and D4, of the London Plan (2021), CP30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010) and DMD6, DMD8, DMD14 and DMD37 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).
description: Part single part two storey side to rear extension (RETROSPECTIVE).
